Episodes.Title: Everything is Beautiful
Episodes.Plot: The King makes himself head of the Church of England while the Catholic Church fights a losing battle to control Henry VIII's desire for an annulment. Anne Boleyn demands that Henry break off contact with Katherine, so the noble Queen is banished from court. On top of that The Reformation is underway.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Robert Sheehan, Bosco Hogan, Philip O'Sullivan, Aaron Monaghan, Eamon Rohan, Guy Carleton, Tony Mckenna, Gary Murphy, Charlie Bonner, Jason Healy, Luke Hayden, Rebekah Wainwright, Catherine Byrne, Paul Burke

Episodes.Title: Tears of Blood
Episodes.Plot: Christmas at the Tudor court is a time for ringing in the new. Mistress Anne Boleyn has replaced the banished Queen Katherine. The King's chaplain, Thomas Cranmer, makes a fact-finding visit to Lutheran Germany while Henry withdraws both the authority and taxes of the Catholic Church at home. And a royal visit to France finally convinces Anne to consummate her relationship with Henry, even as his best friend Charles Brandon suggests that she is no virgin.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Bosco Hogan (Bishop Fisher), David Alpay (Mark Smeaton), Anthony Brophy (Chapuys), Emmanuel Leconte (King Francis), Perdita Weeks (Mary Boleyn), Paul Burke (II) (Messenger), Catherine Byrne (Alice More), Gu

Episodes.Title: Checkmate
Episodes.Plot: Henry's patience finally wears out and he marries Anne in secret, appoints his Lutheran chaplain Thomas Cranmer the head of the Church of England, and strips Queen Katherine of her title and status; the king and new queen have their first child, and are disappointed that it's a girl...whom they christen Elizabeth.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Anthony Brophy (Ambassador Chapuys), Padraic Delaney (George Boleyn), John Kavanagh (Cardinal Campeggio), David Alpay (Mark Smeaton), Bosco Hogan (Bishop Fisher), Sarah Bolger (Princess Mary Tudor), James

Episodes.Title: The Act of Succession
Episodes.Plot: Sir Thomas More refuses to accept Henry's command that his people swear an oath of "allegiance and recognition of the King's supremacy" to both church and state. Anne is made aware of the King's womanizing ways, and arranges then gives her blessing to his next mistress. Also, Anne has a confrontation with Lady Mary, Henry's daughter.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: David Alpay (Mark Smeaton), Padraic Delaney (George Boleyn), Bosco Hogan (Bishop Fisher), Perdita Weeks (Mary Boleyn), Anthony Brophy (Ambassador Chapuys), Catherine Byrne (Alice More), John Kavanagh (Card

Episodes.Title: His Majesty's Pleasure
Episodes.Plot: Attempts to legitimise the King's marriage and increase his power hit unmovable obstacles as Sir Thomas More and Bishop Fisher insist that only God can be head of the church. Imprisoned in the Tower of London they face likely execution unless they take the Oath of Allegiance. Meanwhile Henry's wandering eye continues to roam.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Anthony Brophy (Ambassador Chapuys), Catherine Byrne (Alice More), David Alpay (Mark Smeaton), Padraic Delaney (George Boleyn), Bosco Hogan (Bishop Fisher), Perdita Weeks (Mary Boleyn), Gemma Reeves (Marga

Episodes.Title: The Definition of Love
Episodes.Plot: As the Reformation gathers pace Sir Thomas Cromwell becomes ever more powerful as propagandist-in-chief of a new moral order. Royal confidence has given way to doubt. Henry is haunted by the memory of the executed Thomas More while Queen Anne Boleyn's insecurities border on paranoia. Her husband's affairs continue and an effort to have her daughter Elizabeth betrothed to a French royal fails when the French King refuses to recognise that the infant Princess is of legitimate birth.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Anthony Brophy (Ambassador Chapuys), Rebekah Wainwright (Catherine), John Kavanagh (Cardinal Campeggio), Padraic Delaney (George Boleyn) , Joe Doyle (

Episodes.Title: Matters of State
Episodes.Plot:
The English Reformation is in full swing.
Queen Anne suffers from nightmares and feels threatened by Katherine and her daughter.
Henry pays an unplanned visit to an old friend, Sir John Seymour, father of Jane Seymour.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Joanne King, Guy Carleton, Michael Bates, Stephen Hogan, Paul Bennett, Connor Doyle, Jane Brennan, Tony Flynn, Julia Wakeham, Shane Gately, Michael Pennington, Jack Walsh, Serena Brabazon, Laura Jane Laughlin, Sara

Episodes.Title: Lady in Waiting
Episodes.Plot: At Henry's command Jane Seymour is made a lady-in-waiting to Anne Boleyn, to the discomfort and suspicion of the Queen. When Henry is seriously injured in a jousting match all thoughts turn to who might succeed him. There will be far-reaching consequences if Anne's pregnancy does not deliver a healthy son.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Serena Brabazon, Stephen Hogan, Ronan Conlon, Charlie Bonner, Clive Geraghty, Joanne King, Jonathan Delaney Tynan, Ronnie Masterson, Nicholas Grennell, Sheila Flitton

Episodes.Title: The Act of Treason
Episodes.Plot: Anne has lost a son and with it her last chance at a lasting marriage with Henry. The King's affections are shifting anyway: the Seymour family are awarded rooms at court and seem likely to replace the Boleyns as royal favourites. Several in the court begin to move against Anne who is accused of adultery. Arrests are made of suspected lovers and of Anne herself. All, including the Queen, are sentenced to death.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
Episodes.GuestStars: Rod Hallet, Raad Rawi, Guy Carleton, Clive Geraghty, Stephen Darcy, Phil Kingston, Brian McGuinness, Kate Duggan, Malachy McKenna, Bradley Stevenson, Stephen Hogan, Liam McMahon, Jonathan Ryan

Episodes.Title: Destiny and Fortune
Episodes.Plot: Queen Anne is imprisoned in the Tower, awaiting her execution. The king granted her wish for a special executioner, but he is delayed and the execution has to be postponed. King Henry proposes to Jane Seymour now that his marriage to Anne has been declared null and void. He hopes she will gave him a legitimate, male heir.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and sex scenes
